comments: Information about character encodings used by Ghidra.
Generated on Thu Dec 18 21:18:49 UTC 2025 by CharsetInfoManagerTest.generateCharsetInfoFile

charsets.name: Big5
charsets.comment: A traditional Chinese encoding used mainly in Taiwan and Hong Kong for Traditional Chinese characters. It supports a large repertoire but does not cover all Unicode characters.

charsets.name: Big5-HKSCS
charsets.comment: An extension of Big5 used in Hong Kong that adds Cantonese-specific and government-required characters. It improves compatibility with local applications and legacy data.

charsets.name: x-Big5-HKSCS-2001
charsets.comment: An older version of the Hong Kong Supplementary Character Set based on Big5. It includes Cantonese-specific and government-required characters.

charsets.name: x-Big5-Solaris
charsets.comment: A Solaris-specific variant of Big5. It includes vendor extensions used on Sun systems.

charsets.name: CESU-8
charsets.comment: A variant of UTF-8 designed for internal processing that preserves UTF-16 surrogate pairs. It is not intended for data interchange and is rarely used outside specific systems.

charsets.name: EUC-JP
charsets.comment: A multibyte encoding for Japanese that includes ASCII, JIS X 0208, and half-width kana. It was widely used on Unix systems before UTF-8 became dominant.

charsets.name: x-euc-jp-linux
charsets.comment: A Linux-specific variant of EUC-JP. It includes additional mappings used by Japanese Linux distributions.

charsets.name: EUC-KR
charsets.comment: A Korean encoding based on KS X 1001 combined with ASCII. It supports modern Hangul syllables and was common on Unix platforms.

charsets.name: x-EUC-TW
charsets.comment: A Taiwanese encoding supporting Traditional Chinese and additional plane mappings. It includes characters from CNS 11643.

charsets.name: x-eucJP-Open
charsets.comment: An extended EUC-JP variant used in some open-source systems. It includes additional Kanji beyond standard EUC-JP.

charsets.name: GB18030
charsets.comment: China's mandatory national encoding standard that covers all Unicode characters using 1, 2, or 4 bytes. It supersedes GBK and GB2312 and ensures compatibility with rare and historical characters.

charsets.name: GB2312
charsets.comment: An early Simplified Chinese encoding standard covering the most common characters used in mainland China. It served as the foundation for GBK and GB18030.

charsets.name: GBK
charsets.comment: An extension of GB2312 that adds thousands of Simplified and Traditional Chinese characters. It is widely used in Windows systems and is backward-compatible with GB2312.

charsets.name: IBM-Thai
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Thai script based on TIS-620. It supports Thai characters and punctuation for legacy IBM systems.

charsets.name: IBM00858
charsets.comment: A DOS-era IBM code page similar to CP850 but with the Euro symbol added. It supports Western European languages in legacy environments.

charsets.name: IBM01140
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page based on IBM037 with Euro support. It is used on IBM mainframes for Western European languages.

charsets.name: IBM01141
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page similar to IBM273 with Euro support. It supports German-language environments on IBM systems.

charsets.name: IBM01142
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page derived from IBM277 with Euro support. It is used for Danish and Norwegian text on IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: IBM01143
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page based on IBM278 with Euro support. It is designed for Finnish and Swedish environments.

charsets.name: IBM01144
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page derived from IBM280 with Euro support. It supports Italian-language mainframe systems.

charsets.name: IBM01145
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page based on IBM284 with Euro support. It is used for Spanish-language environments on IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: IBM01146
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page derived from IBM285 with Euro support. It supports UK English on IBM systems.

charsets.name: IBM01147
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page based on IBM297 with Euro support. It is used for French-language mainframe environments.

charsets.name: IBM01148
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page derived from IBM500 with Euro support. It supports multiple Western European languages on IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: IBM01149
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page based on IBM871 with Euro support. It is used for Icelandic-language environments on IBM systems.

charsets.name: IBM037
charsets.comment: A core EBCDIC code page used in the United States and some Western countries. It supports basic Latin characters and control codes for IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: x-IBM1006
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Urdu written in Arabic script (IBM EBCDIC). It supports contextual shaping for proper display.

charsets.name: x-IBM1025
charsets.comment: An IBM Cyrillic code page used in Eastern Europe (IBM EBCDIC). It supports Russian, Bulgarian, and Serbian Cyrillic.

charsets.name: IBM1026
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page used for Turkish language support. It includes Latin characters with Turkish-specific letters.

charsets.name: x-IBM1046
charsets.comment: An IBM Arabic code page supporting contextual shaping (IBM EBCDIC). It is used in Middle Eastern IBM environments.

charsets.name: IBM1047
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page designed to better align with ASCII for easier interoperability. It is used in Unix-like environments on IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: x-IBM1097
charsets.comment: An IBM Farsi code page (IBM EBCDIC). It supports Arabic-derived Persian script with contextual shaping.

charsets.name: x-IBM1098
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Farsi with alternative mappings (IBM EBCDIC). It supports Persian letters and punctuation.

charsets.name: x-IBM1112
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Estonian (IBM EBCDIC). It includes diacritics and letters used in Estonian orthography.

charsets.name: x-IBM1122
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Latvian (IBM EBCDIC). It supports Latvian diacritics and punctuation.

charsets.name: x-IBM1123
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Ukrainian (IBM EBCDIC). It includes Ukrainian Cyrillic letters not found in KOI8-R.

charsets.name: x-IBM1124
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Lithuanian (IBM EBCDIC). It supports Lithuanian diacritics and special characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM1129
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Vietnamese (IBM EBCDIC). It uses combining diacritics to represent Vietnamese tones.

charsets.name: x-IBM1166
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Belarusian (IBM EBCDIC). It includes Belarusian Cyrillic letters and punctuation.

charsets.name: x-IBM1364
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Korean (IBM EBCDIC). It supports Hangul syllables and Hanja characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM1381
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Simplified Chinese (IBM EBCDIC). It includes GB2312 characters and IBM extensions.

charsets.name: x-IBM1383
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Traditional Chinese (IBM EBCDIC). It includes Big5 characters and IBM-specific additions.

charsets.name: IBM273
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page used for German-language systems. It includes German umlauts and standard Latin characters.

charsets.name: IBM277
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Danish and Norwegian languages. It supports regional letters and punctuation used in Scandinavia.

charsets.name: IBM278
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page used for Finnish and Swedish languages. It includes Nordic characters and standard Latin letters.

charsets.name: IBM280
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Italian-language environments. It supports accented Italian characters and punctuation.

charsets.name: IBM284
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page used for Spanish-language systems. It includes Spanish accented letters and punctuation.

charsets.name: IBM285
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for UK English. It supports British punctuation and currency symbols.

charsets.name: IBM290
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Japanese Katakana. It was used on IBM mainframes before multibyte encodings became common.

charsets.name: x-IBM29626C
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Chinese used in AIX systems (IBM EBCDIC). It supports CNS 11643 planes and extended characters.

charsets.name: IBM297
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for French-language systems. It includes accented French characters and punctuation.

charsets.name: x-IBM300
charsets.comment: A double-byte IBM code page for Japanese (IBM EBCDIC). It supports Kanji, Hiragana, Katakana, and symbols.

charsets.name: x-IBM33722
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Korean used in AIX (IBM EBCDIC). It supports KS X 1001 and extended Hangul.

charsets.name: IBM420
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Arabic script. It supports contextual shaping required for Arabic text.

charsets.name: IBM424
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Hebrew script. It supports Hebrew letters and right-to-left text direction.

charsets.name: IBM437
charsets.comment: The original IBM PC code page used in DOS. It includes box-drawing characters and basic Latin letters.

charsets.name: IBM500
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page supporting multiple Western European languages. It includes accented characters and punctuation for multilingual environments.

charsets.name: x-IBM737
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Greek. It includes Greek letters and basic punctuation.

charsets.name: IBM775
charsets.comment: A code page used for Baltic languages such as Latvian and Lithuanian. It supports diacritics and regional characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM833
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Korean (IBM EBCDIC). It supports early Hangul encodings and Hanja.

charsets.name: x-IBM834
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Korean similar to x-IBM833 but with additional characters (IBM EBCDIC). It supports extended Hangul and Hanja.

charsets.name: IBM850
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Western European languages. It expands on CP437 by adding more accented characters.

charsets.name: IBM852
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Central and Eastern European languages. It supports diacritics used in Polish, Czech, Slovak, and related languages.

charsets.name: IBM855
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Cyrillic languages. It includes Russian, Bulgarian, and Serbian Cyrillic characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM856
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Hebrew. It supports Hebrew letters but lacks right-to-left control characters.

charsets.name: IBM857
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Turkish. It includes Turkish-specific letters and punctuation.

charsets.name: IBM860
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Portuguese as used in Portugal. It includes accented characters and symbols.

charsets.name: IBM861
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Icelandic. It includes Icelandic letters and diacritics.

charsets.name: IBM862
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Hebrew. It supports Hebrew letters and right-to-left text.

charsets.name: IBM863
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Canadian French. It includes accented French characters used in Canada.

charsets.name: IBM864
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Arabic. It supports Arabic letters and contextual forms.

charsets.name: IBM865
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Nordic languages. It includes characters used in Danish, Norwegian, and Icelandic.

charsets.name: IBM866
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Russian and other Cyrillic languages. It became widely used in Eastern Europe and the former Soviet Union.

charsets.name: IBM868
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Arabic used in some regions. It supports Arabic letters and basic punctuation.

charsets.name: IBM869
charsets.comment: A DOS code page for Greek. It includes Greek letters and diacritics.

charsets.name: IBM870
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for multilingual Latin scripts including Eastern European languages. It supports accented characters and punctuation.

charsets.name: IBM871
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Icelandic. It includes Icelandic letters and special characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM874
charsets.comment: A Windows and DOS code page for Thai. It supports Thai script without contextual shaping.

charsets.name: x-IBM875
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Greek. It includes Greek letters and punctuation for IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: IBM918
charsets.comment: An EBCDIC code page for Urdu. It supports Arabic-derived Urdu script with contextual shaping.

charsets.name: x-IBM921
charsets.comment: A Baltic code page supporting Latvian, Lithuanian, and Estonian. It includes regional diacritics and symbols.

charsets.name: x-IBM922
charsets.comment: A Baltic code page similar to x-IBM921 but with alternative mappings. It supports additional regional characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM930
charsets.comment: A Japanese EBCDIC mixed single-byte and double-byte code page. It supports Kanji and Katakana for IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: x-IBM933
charsets.comment: A Korean EBCDIC mixed-byte code page. It supports Hangul and Hanja for IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: x-IBM935
charsets.comment: A Simplified Chinese EBCDIC mixed-byte code page. It supports GB2312 characters for IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: x-IBM937
charsets.comment: A Traditional Chinese EBCDIC mixed-byte code page. It supports Big5 characters for IBM mainframes.

charsets.name: x-IBM939
charsets.comment: A Japanese EBCDIC mixed-byte code page similar to x-IBM930 but with extended characters. It supports Kanji and Katakana.

charsets.name: x-IBM942
charsets.comment: A Shift_JIS-based IBM code page for Japanese. It includes IBM extensions and vendor-specific characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM942C
charsets.comment: A variant of x-IBM942 with corrected mappings. It improves compatibility with standard Shift_JIS.

charsets.name: x-IBM943
charsets.comment: An IBM code page combining Shift_JIS with additional Kanji. It supports a wide range of Japanese characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM943C
charsets.comment: A corrected version of x-IBM943 with improved character mappings. It enhances compatibility with Windows-31J.

charsets.name: x-IBM948
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Simplified Chinese based on GBK. It includes IBM extensions for additional characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM949
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Korean based on EUC-KR. It includes extended Hangul syllables.

charsets.name: x-IBM949C
charsets.comment: A corrected version of x-IBM949 with improved mappings. It enhances compatibility with Windows Korean encodings.

charsets.name: x-IBM950
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Traditional Chinese based on Big5. It includes IBM extensions for additional characters.

charsets.name: x-IBM964
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Traditional Chinese used in Taiwan. It supports CNS 11643 plane mappings.

charsets.name: x-IBM970
charsets.comment: An IBM code page for Korean supporting Hangul and Hanja. It is used in IBM mainframe environments.

charsets.name: x-ISCII91
charsets.comment: An Indian encoding standard supporting multiple Indic scripts through a shared code structure. It uses shift codes to switch between scripts.

charsets.name: x-ISO-2022-CN-CNS
charsets.comment: A variant of ISO-2022-CN supporting CNS 11643 character planes. It enables Traditional Chinese encoding in 7-bit environments.

charsets.name: x-ISO-2022-CN-GB
charsets.comment: A variant of ISO-2022-CN supporting GB2312. It enables Simplified Chinese encoding in 7-bit environments.

charsets.name: ISO-2022-JP
charsets.comment: A Japanese encoding that switches between ASCII, JIS X 0201, and JIS X 0208 using escape sequences. It was widely used for email and early web content in Japan.

charsets.name: ISO-2022-JP-2
charsets.comment: An extension of ISO-2022-JP that adds additional character sets including Chinese and Korean. It was intended for multilingual communication but saw limited adoption.

charsets.name: ISO-2022-KR
charsets.comment: A Korean encoding that switches between ASCII and KS X 1001 using escape sequences. It was used in email systems that required 7-bit compatibility.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-1
charsets.comment: A widely used Western European encoding also known as Latin-1. It supports major Western European languages but lacks the Euro symbol.

charsets.name: x-iso-8859-11
charsets.comment: A Thai encoding similar to TIS-620 but with additional control characters. It supports Thai script without shaping.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-13
charsets.comment: A Baltic language encoding supporting Latvian, Lithuanian, and Estonian. It includes diacritics needed for regional languages.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-15
charsets.comment: A revision of Latin-1 that adds the Euro symbol and replaces some rarely used characters. It was intended as a modernized Western European encoding.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-16
charsets.comment: A South-Eastern European encoding supporting Romanian, Albanian, and related languages. It includes characters missing from earlier ISO-8859 sets.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-2
charsets.comment: A Central European encoding supporting Polish, Czech, Slovak, and Hungarian. It includes diacritics used in Slavic and Finno-Ugric languages.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-3
charsets.comment: A South European encoding supporting Maltese, Esperanto, and Turkish. It was less widely adopted than other ISO-8859 variants.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-4
charsets.comment: A Baltic encoding supporting Estonian, Latvian, and Lithuanian. It was later superseded by ISO-8859-13.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-5
charsets.comment: A Cyrillic encoding supporting Russian, Bulgarian, and Serbian. It was used before Unicode and Windows-1251 became dominant.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-6
charsets.comment: An Arabic encoding supporting basic Arabic letters. It does not include contextual shaping, making it unsuitable for display without additional processing.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-7
charsets.comment: A Greek encoding supporting modern Greek characters. It was widely used before Unicode adoption.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-8
charsets.comment: A Hebrew encoding supporting Hebrew letters. It does not include vowel points or right-to-left control characters.

charsets.name: ISO-8859-9
charsets.comment: A Turkish encoding based on Latin-1 but replacing Icelandic letters with Turkish ones. It supports modern Turkish orthography.

charsets.name: x-JIS0208
charsets.comment: A Japanese character set containing thousands of Kanji and kana. It forms the basis of many Japanese encodings including Shift_JIS and EUC-JP.

charsets.name: JIS_X0201
charsets.comment: A Japanese encoding containing ASCII and half-width Katakana. It is often used as part of larger Japanese encoding schemes.

charsets.name: JIS_X0212-1990
charsets.comment: A supplementary Japanese character set containing additional Kanji. It is used in extended Japanese encodings such as ISO-2022-JP-2.

charsets.name: x-Johab
charsets.comment: A Korean encoding supporting full Hangul composition. It provides complete coverage of modern Hangul syllables.

charsets.name: KOI8-R
charsets.comment: A Cyrillic encoding widely used in Russia and the former Soviet Union. It supports Russian, Bulgarian, and other Cyrillic languages.

charsets.name: KOI8-U
charsets.comment: A Cyrillic encoding designed for Ukrainian. It extends KOI8-R with additional Ukrainian letters.

charsets.name: x-MacArabic
charsets.comment: A legacy Mac OS encoding for Arabic. It includes contextual forms for proper Arabic rendering.

charsets.name: x-MacCentralEurope
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Central European languages. It supports diacritics used in Polish, Czech, Slovak, and Hungarian.

charsets.name: x-MacCroatian
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Croatian. It includes accented characters used in Croatian orthography.

charsets.name: x-MacCyrillic
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Cyrillic languages. It supports Russian, Bulgarian, and Serbian Cyrillic.

charsets.name: x-MacDingbat
charsets.comment: A Mac OS symbol encoding containing decorative and typographic symbols. It includes ornaments, arrows, and shapes.

charsets.name: x-MacGreek
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Greek. It includes Greek letters and diacritics used in modern Greek.

charsets.name: x-MacHebrew
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Hebrew. It supports Hebrew letters and right-to-left text.

charsets.name: x-MacIceland
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Icelandic. It includes Icelandic letters and diacritics.

charsets.name: x-MacRoman
charsets.comment: The primary Mac OS Roman encoding for Western European languages. It includes accented letters and typographic symbols.

charsets.name: x-MacRomania
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Romanian. It includes Romanian diacritics and punctuation.

charsets.name: x-MacSymbol
charsets.comment: A Mac OS symbol encoding containing mathematical and typographic symbols. It includes arrows, operators, and Greek letters.

charsets.name: x-MacThai
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Thai. It supports Thai script without contextual shaping.

charsets.name: x-MacTurkish
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Turkish. It includes Turkish-specific letters and punctuation.

charsets.name: x-MacUkraine
charsets.comment: A Mac OS encoding for Ukrainian. It includes Ukrainian Cyrillic letters and diacritics.

charsets.name: x-MS932_0213
charsets.comment: A Microsoft variant of Shift_JIS that includes JIS X 0213 characters. It expands the available Kanji set beyond standard Shift_JIS.

charsets.name: x-MS950-HKSCS
charsets.comment: A Microsoft Big5 variant including Hong Kong Supplementary Character Set mappings. It supports Cantonese-specific and government-required characters.

charsets.name: x-MS950-HKSCS-XP
charsets.comment: A Windows XP version of the HKSCS Big5 extension. It includes older mappings that differ from later HKSCS releases.

charsets.name: x-mswin-936
charsets.comment: A Microsoft implementation of GBK for Simplified Chinese. It supports a wide range of Chinese characters used on Windows systems.

charsets.name: x-PCK
charsets.comment: A variant of Shift_JIS used on Solaris systems. It includes vendor-specific extensions for Japanese text.

charsets.name: Shift_JIS
charsets.comment: A major Japanese encoding combining single-byte and double-byte sequences. It supports Kanji, Hiragana, Katakana, and ASCII.

charsets.name: x-SJIS_0213
charsets.comment: A Shift_JIS variant supporting JIS X 0213 characters. It expands the Kanji repertoire for modern Japanese usage.

charsets.name: TIS-620
charsets.comment: The standard Thai character encoding used in Thailand. It supports Thai script without contextual shaping.

charsets.name: windows-1250
charsets.comment: A Central European Windows encoding supporting Polish, Czech, Slovak, and Hungarian. It includes diacritics used in Slavic languages.

charsets.name: windows-1251
charsets.comment: A Cyrillic Windows encoding supporting Russian, Bulgarian, and Serbian. It became the de facto standard for Cyrillic text on Windows.

charsets.name: windows-1252
charsets.comment: A Western European Windows encoding often mistaken for ISO-8859-1. It includes additional printable characters such as smart quotes.

charsets.name: windows-1253
charsets.comment: A Greek Windows encoding supporting modern Greek. It includes accented Greek letters and punctuation.

charsets.name: windows-1254
charsets.comment: A Turkish Windows encoding similar to ISO-8859-9. It supports Turkish-specific letters and symbols.

charsets.name: windows-1255
charsets.comment: A Hebrew Windows encoding supporting Hebrew letters and vowel points. It includes right-to-left control characters.

charsets.name: windows-1256
charsets.comment: An Arabic Windows encoding supporting Arabic letters and contextual forms. It includes characters for Persian and Urdu as well.

charsets.name: windows-1257
charsets.comment: A Baltic Windows encoding supporting Latvian, Lithuanian, and Estonian. It includes regional diacritics and punctuation.

charsets.name: windows-1258
charsets.comment: A Vietnamese Windows encoding supporting tone marks and diacritics. It uses combining characters to represent Vietnamese vowels.

charsets.name: windows-31j
charsets.comment: A Microsoft extension of Shift_JIS adding vendor-specific characters. It is widely used in Japanese Windows environments.

charsets.name: x-windows-50220
charsets.comment: A Windows variant of ISO-2022-JP using escape sequences for Japanese text. It supports 7-bit transport environments such as email.

charsets.name: x-windows-50221
charsets.comment: A Windows version of ISO-2022-JP that allows 8-bit bytes. It improves compatibility with applications that do not enforce strict 7-bit paths.

charsets.name: x-windows-874
charsets.comment: A Windows encoding for Thai similar to TIS-620. It includes additional symbols used in Windows applications.

charsets.name: x-windows-949
charsets.comment: A Windows encoding for Korean based on EUC-KR. It includes extended Hangul syllables and vendor-specific characters.

charsets.name: x-windows-950
charsets.comment: A Windows encoding for Traditional Chinese based on Big5. It includes additional characters used in Taiwanese and Hong Kong systems.

charsets.name: x-windows-iso2022jp
charsets.comment: A Windows variant of ISO-2022-JP with modified escape sequences. It improves compatibility with Japanese email and legacy applications.
